title: [SPARK-39889][SQL] Use different error classes for numeric/interval divided by 0
body:
#### Context

- Spark-3.4 PR: https://github.com/apache/spark/commit/5420562156
- Others:
  - https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/6182

#### What changes were proposed in SPARK pull request?

Yet another change to the error classes.

Currently, when numbers are divided by 0 under ANSI mode, the error message is like
```
  [DIVIDE_BY_ZERO] Division by zero.
```

- A new error class for the interval division error: "`INTERVAL_DIVIDED_BY_ZERO`"

#### Why are the changes needed in Spark?

- Better error messages


#### Does this PR introduce _any_ user-facing change?

- Yes, Use different error classes for numeric/interval divided by 0.

#### Why it might affect RAPIDS?

- Again, we need to modify the initialization of exceptions to accept `Option[QueryConcept]`
  as described in https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/6182
- Throw the new `INTERVAL_DIVIDED_BY_ZERO` class for interval division by zero instead of `DIVIDED_BY_ZERO`.

#### Impact on Testing?

Yes.
- review integration tests calling [arithmetic_ops_test.py::_test_div_by_zero](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/blob/branch-22.08/integration_tests/src/main/python/arithmetic_ops_test.py#L827)
- [arithmetic_ops_test.py::test_day_time_interval_divided_by_zero_scalar](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/blob/branch-22.08/integration_tests/src/main/python/arithmetic_ops_test.py#L1142) checks for the error message `SparkArithmeticException: Division by zero.`
- [arithmetic_ops_test.py::test_day_time_interval_scalar_divided_by_zero](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/blob/branch-22.08/integration_tests/src/main/python/arithmetic_ops_test.py#L1159) checks for the error message `SparkArithmeticException: Division by zero.`

#### Requires Doc update?

No.
